captions.text:
Hey, can you turn it up?
I feel like Neo.

Why, because you're the chosen one?
I could be the chosen one. You don't know.

But no, that's not what I meant.
What did you mean?

Just that the world feels off to me.
Like how?

It's kinda hard to explain. Like it's artificial
somehow.

Like we're dreaming all this through a computer
system and our physical bodies are just being

used as batteries.
Well, I don't know. I don't know, that's the

point. I just know that something's wrong...
something not right with the world.

Yeah, it's called humanity.
It's like we're living in an artificial world,

oblivious to the real world going on around
us.

I think you just watch too many sci-fi movies.
Didn't you do a marathon last weekend of sci-fi

films?
Yeah, I did The Matrix, Dark City, The 13th

Floor, Inception, and Men in Black.
Yeah, all movies that deal with alternate

realities.
I don't think I get your point.

It's like whenever you watch a bunch of scary
movies and then you want to climb into my

bed and sleep 'cause you're scared? You watched
all these movies that have a fake reality,

and now you're convinced your reality is fake.
You're talking yourself into this, can't you

see that?
I guess that's possible.

Who, deja vu.
What? Where? What happened?

There was an orange cat, and then another
one just like it.

How much like it? Was it the same cat? A deja
vu is usually a glitch in the Matrix! Holy

sh*t!
Calm down, calm down. We have two orange cats.

They're twins. Remember?
Oh, yeah. Yeah, you're right. For a second

there my world almost came crashing down around
me.

What does it matter if it's all fake?
So you're admitting that it's all fake?

No. I was being sarcastic. You need to learn
not to take me so seriously.

You know, sarcasm is also usually a glitch
in the Matrix.

I'm with the guy in the hat.
They're both wearing hats.

The guy on the right, the guy in the beanie.
That figures, he's even stupider than you

are.
Thanks!

title: Conversations With Myself About Movies - The Matrix
